posts.title: World Council for Health Welcomes the Appointment of Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as the U.S. Secretary of Health and Human Services
posts.description: World Council for Health (WCH) welcomes the appointment of Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as the U.S. Secretary of Health and Human Services (HHS).

posts.title: Can red light therapy mend our children's hearts?
posts.description: New research is revealing the extent to which Covid injections have harmed children. But red light therapy offers a beacon of hope.

posts.title: 5 Recent Substacks Worth Your Attention
posts.description: This week's seen a flurry of excellent posts we want to share with you.

posts.title: Look what they did to our antibodies
posts.description: Our immune systems are supposed to fight viruses. Now they invite them round for tea. It's all down to IgG4...

posts.description: Wealth, poverty, and the unyielding struggle.

posts.title: Tonight! Real talk on exiting the WHO...
posts.description: Join us today for an important online conversation on why and how nations should consider exiting the World Health Organization (WHO).

posts.title: Vaccinating Over 65s: Lifesaving or a Misplaced Bet?
posts.description: Vaccines are supposed to be the cornerstone of public health, especially to protect the elderly - but do they work well enough for older adults?

posts.title: NEW Paper Identifies 'Smoking Gun' of Chronic Disease
posts.description: ... and most of us are in the crosshairs. The US Navy knew about it way back in 1971, yet nothing was done to stop it.

posts.title: Thank you, Arthur Firstenberg
posts.description: Author, environmentalist and activist Arthur Firstenberg, has died. His service to people and planet will never be forgotten.

posts.title: Is vaccination really the best defence against measles?
posts.description: The data on efficacy, safety, and outbreaks reveal a more nuanced picture to that portrayed by corporate media. Time to separate fact from fiction.

posts.title: A Message to Vaccinators and Those Who Trust Them
posts.description: German association of doctors asks "How long will [you]... continue to urge patients to undergo useless, demonstrably harmful and questionable interventions...?"
posts.author: World Council for Health
